benchmark_details.name: RankMamba: Benchmarking Mamba’s Document Ranking Performance in the Era of Transformers
benchmark_details.overview: This work examines Mamba’s efficacy through a classical IR task—document ranking, and benchmarks Mamba models against transformer-based models characterized by varying structures, sizes, pre-training objectives, and attention patterns.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To comprehensively assess the performance of Mamba in the document ranking task compared to transformer-based models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Mamba models have lower training throughput compared to efficient attention implementations.

data.source: MS MARCO document ranking dataset and official document ranking dev set, including TREC DL19 and DL20.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the official evaluation setup.
methodology.interpretation: Higher MRR and NDCG scores indicate better performance in ranking relevance.
methodology.baseline_results: Roberta-large achieves 0.4434 MRR on MSMARCO Dev set.
methodology.validation: Results cross-validated with multiple datasets including TREC DL19 and DL20.
